title: temporary fix for trusting for new keys for your JID
message:
temporary fix for trusting for new keys for your JID
- when i signed in from a second device, a new OMEMO device was created for the other jid, and thus, for the first time, I had to trust a key from a device I did not know. We need UI/UX here obviously, but for now, this handles the error case.

Also fixes a number of issues with running on a very slow, high latency network (like I am currently on while traveling)

title: Multiple improvements to multi-select, sharing and forwarding
message:
Multiple improvements to multi-select, sharing and forwarding
- contact picker now works with multiple selections for both group creation and sharing/forwarding
- you can now share photos with multiple selected contacts
- bug related to multiple mode not return proper selected items fixed by using "stable IDs"

title: updated strings from transifex
message: updated strings from transifex

title: don't auto-start OTR in all cases; display fingerprint w/o session
message:
don't auto-start OTR in all cases; display fingerprint w/o session
- We were over zealously trying to start OTR sessions before. Now we will not, so that we can give them a chance to work, and not overwhelm other clients.
- We also need to be able to display OTR fingerprints for contacts, even if we don't have an active session with them. This will now show a default fingerprint for the contact if they are not conneted.

title: Fixes #154: add Trust On First Use and Verification Warning
message:
Fixes #154: add Trust On First Use and Verification Warning
The first time you encounter a contact and their OTR key, there will be no warning. If the key changes, the user will be warned and prompted to verify it on the profile screen.
This is a work in progress fix, with a few more user expereince tweaks to come.

title: update chatsecure push
message: update chatsecure push

title: move to manually approval of new contacts/subscriptions
message:
move to manually approval of new contacts/subscriptions
- this was a pretty major overhaul of the subscribe/subscribed logic and flow

title: name the APKs with the actual versionName
message:
name the APKs with the actual versionName

This uses the actual versionName used in the app to name the APK file that
is built.  This keeps the git release tag, versionName, and APK name all
in sync, automatically.  This makes it a lot easier to do automatic things
like with F-Droid reproducible builds:

refs #92
https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/merge_requests/1442

title: set versionName based on git release tag
message:
set versionName based on git release tag

This makes it easy to tell which debug build a device is running, since the
versionName now automatically describes the exact commit that was built,
based on `git describe`, e.g.:  15.0.1-BETA-8-33-gc2e8e8a

For release builds, i.e. builds from commits that are tagged as releases,
the versionName will be just the tag name: 15.0.1-BETA-9.  So the release
tag must be created before making the release build.

This also moves versionCode from the AndroidManifest.xml to build.gradle
just to keep the two versions together.  That part is optional.

title: Major improvement to message queueing for iOS knock/push and message status
message:
Major improvement to message queueing for iOS knock/push and message status
When a "knock" push is sent to iOS, the outoing message will be postponed until the contact comes online and a new OTR session is established. When this happens, the queued/postponed messages will be sent.
In addition, proper notification of message delivery status update are now implemented, by adding the message threadID

title: smooth out panic triggering shutdown/lock
message:
smooth out panic triggering shutdown/lock

The ACTION_TRIGGER Intent needs to be processed in onCreate(), then
followed with a finish() so that onResume(), onPause(), etc. do not get
called, thereby triggering cacheword.

This includes a jar of the panic stuff, since it is in rapid flux, and not
yet ready for a real release.

title: de-couple lock from others in panic setup
message:
de-couple lock from others in panic setup

Allow lock to be checked even if "uninstall", etc. are checked so that the
default response can be controlled from that preference as well.

message: re-enable shutdown/lock on main menu

title: clearing the XMPP account passphrase breaks Zom's working assumptions
message:
clearing the XMPP account passphrase breaks Zom's working assumptions

If the XMPP account password is cleared when the user locks the app, then
they will most likely not have that password, and therefore will never be
able to use the account again.  In Zom, the XMPP account password is auto-
generated and stored.

title: purge unused translations, fixes lint ExtraTranslation
message:
purge unused translations, fixes lint ExtraTranslation

There were still translations of strings that were removed.  This removes
those translations.

title: arrays.xml no longer needs to be translated
message:
arrays.xml no longer needs to be translated

The translatable bits have been moved to strings.xml

title: always use internal data store for chat logs and media
message:
always use internal data store for chat logs and media

The code for handling storing the IOCipher container file on the SD card is
complicated and brittle.  There are all sorts of crashy edge cases. This
moves the IOCipher store to always be in the internal storage.  If a user
is running out of space on their /data partition, they can move the entire
Zom app to the SD Card aka External Storage.

title: remove global preferences from Imps.ProviderSettings
message:
remove global preferences from Imps.ProviderSettings

Imps.ProviderSettings is for account profiles, and is not the place for
global settings. These global preferences are not sensitive, so they do not
need to be stored encrypted.  Instead, the global prefs are stored in a
standard SharedPreferences file.  A static utility class is used to make
accessing the prefs from the code dead simple.

This also purges the unused "background image" and "show grid" preferences.

title: use constants for return values in SettingActivity
message:
use constants for return values in SettingActivity

This makes things clearer, especially as another constant will be added for
panic.

title: handle incoming Panic.ACTION_TRIGGER Intents in RouterActivity
message:
handle incoming Panic.ACTION_TRIGGER Intents in RouterActivity

For now, incoming panic triggers are handled by RouterActivity, since that
is the sole dispatcher of incoming Intents.  This gets the basic, default
panic response working: lock app on panic.

title: allow shutdownAndLock() to be called with a Service or Context
message:
allow shutdownAndLock() to be called with a Service or Context

This is not used yet, since the structure of the shutdown procedure fails
when called from a Service.  The idea is to make a PanicReceiverService
that handles incoming panic triggers entirely in the background, without
having to popup any Activity for this app.

title: use constants for Intent Extra names for easy traceability
message:
use constants for Intent Extra names for easy traceability

In Android Studio, just Ctrl-Click to see where something is used.  That
doesn't work for plain strings though, and its a good, standard pattern to
use constants for Intent Extra names.

title: Remove system-app permissions that this app can never use
message:
Remove system-app permissions that this app can never use

Here is what lint has to say about it:
ProtectedPermissions: Using system app permission
../../src/main/AndroidManifest.xml:8: Permission is only granted to system apps
   5
   6     <uses-sdk android:minSdkVersion="8" android:targetSdkVersion="15" />
   7 	<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
   8     <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_MEDIA_STORAGE" />
   9     <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
  10     <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_MEDIA_STORAGE" />
Priority: 5 / 10
Category: Correctness
Severity: Error
Explanation: Using system app permission.
Permissions with the protection level signature or signatureOrSystem are
only granted to system apps. If an app is a regular non-system app, it will
never be able to use these permissions.

More info:

To suppress this error, use the issue id "ProtectedPermissions" as
explained in the Suppressing Warnings and Errors section.

message:
remove duplicate and unused android:id

title: use symlinks to provide alternate folders for Hebrew and Indonesian
message:
use symlinks to provide alternate folders for Hebrew and Indonesian

These two languages must be included twice (iw/he and id/in)

For a full discussion of why, see:
https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroidclient/issues/139
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5074769/cyanogenmod-translate-a-project/8470980#8470980
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8393771/android-not-using-finding-my-hebrew-localization

title: re-enable lint errors, lint is our friend
message:
re-enable lint errors, lint is our friend

Android's lint provides many very useful checks of various degrees of
importance.  The "errors" are almost always things that should be fixed.

Run lint in Android Studio from the menu:
  Analyze --> Inspect Code...

title: fix lint ResourceAsColor error
message:
fix lint ResourceAsColor error

Should pass resolved color instead of resource id here:
  getResources().getColor(android.R.color.holo_red_light)

Methods that take a color in the form of an integer should be passed an RGB
triple, not the actual color resource id. You must call
`getResources().getColor(resource)` to resolve the actual color value first

title: delete files that are ignored in .gitignore
message:
delete files that are ignored in .gitignore

The .iml files in particular are troublesome.  Android Studio updates them
automatically with machine-specific paths.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16736856/what-should-be-in-my-gitignore-for-an-android-studio-project

title: use gradle android plugin v1.3.x
message:
use gradle android plugin v1.3.x

Using the version "1.3.+' means use any version of 1.3, which gives some
flexibility when running the build without adding much risk of breakage.
For example, if Debian includes v1.3.1 while the newest is v1.3.3, gradle
will just use the version from Debian.

title: add sha256 sums for all downloaded jars
message:

title: Merge pull request #698 from eighthave/master
message:
Merge pull request #698 from eighthave/master

make-release-build: disable faketime since it is problematic

title: make-release-build: disable faketime since it is problematic
message:
make-release-build: disable faketime since it is problematic

faketime is used to normalize all of the timestamps to get a reproducible
build.  Since this is still far off from getting a perfectly reproducible
build, i.e. the same hashsum, just remove this for now.  faketime is not
needed to get a reproducible build in terms of the APK signature, only the
hash.

title: improve regexps for linkifying and add bitcoin: for payments
message:
improve regexps for linkifying and add bitcoin: for payments

These changes to the regexps make them more accurate from my tests by
limiting more the scope of text that they will match.  For example, < and
> need to be ignored since they are used in HTML/XML tags, which might be
wrapping a URI.

message:

fixes #677 on github: update asmack to address "sessionSupported" bug

title: make-release-build: use version from `git describe` in original name format
message:
make-release-build: use version from `git describe` in original name format

This makes it so that the 'v' is included before the version, like the
ChatSecure releases, i.e. ChatSecure-v14.2.0.apk rather than
ChatSecure-14.2.0.apk.

For builds of versions that are not tagged, the version name will be the
format of `git describe`, which includes the previous tag and commit ID.

field of the manifest, it needs to be manually specified.

Some small fixes

title: partial fix #2147 if OTR is set to require/force then don't send messages without OTR
message:
partial fix #2147 if OTR is set to require/force then don't send messages without OTR
Also attempts to set messages to POSTPONE state, and resend them when OTR is activated

title: use java.security.SecureRandom to be sure
message:
use java.security.SecureRandom to be sure

OTR's r value should really be a good random number :-|

This also switches instantiation of SecureRandom to when it is first used,
rather than when the class is instantiated since SecureRandom is not always
required.

title: Fix SMP for non-ASCII chars.
message:
Fix SMP for non-ASCII chars.

secret.length() is the length of the String, but OTR needs to be aware of the
length of the actual byte[]. With UTF-8, the length of the string will be
different than the number of bytes.  This is easily confused because with
ASCII, the length of the String and the byte[] will be the same.

closes https://github.com/otr4j/otr4j/pull/47

title: fixes #5132 handles cases where there is no display name for some reason
message: fixes #5132 handles cases where there is no display name for some reason

title: feature: add support for image preview in conversation view
message: feature: add support for image preview in conversation view

title: fixes bug #2146 messages sent while offline stay in right place!
message:
fixes bug #2146 messages sent while offline stay in right place!
previously, the sent time was being reset to -1 for offline/postponed messages. that no longer happens, and now messages will keep the sent time, and still be re-sent once you come back online. this commit also attempts to improve handling of sending of postponed messages, and the resulting delivery state tracking.

title: fixes #3256 removes debug code that caused crash
message: fixes #3256 removes debug code that caused crash

title: add new base art images
message: add new base art images

title: multiple fixes to import from content:// URIs and image resizing
message:
multiple fixes to import from content:// URIs and image resizing
Apps like CameraV share images and video direclty using content:// and InputStreams, and there is no file:// path available. Our earlier import code always expected a file on disk, and that was bad. This update switches fully to streams, and also has some additional logic for figuring out mime-types, when that is not provided or clear.

This update also reduces storage and transfer sizes of images on import, since that has been causing problems both with local data storage size and speed/reliability of transfer.

Release build tweaks

title: do not include BUILD.MF in debug APK, it breaks signature verification
message:
do not include BUILD.MF in debug APK, it breaks signature verification

For some strange reason, including a BUILD file in a debug APK breaks the
signature verification, but works fine in the release APK.  This is the
error:

jarsigner: java.lang.SecurityException: invalid SHA1 signature file digest for res/drawable-xxhdpi-v4/abc_list_selector_disabled_holo_dark.9.png

title: make versionName match the signed release git tag
message:
make versionName match the signed release git tag

This keeps things consistent, and makes it easier to script things, like
in ./make-release-build

title: Enable Service to response to CacheWord in case of restart/kills
message:
Enable Service to response to CacheWord in case of restart/kills
In some cases, on devices with low memory like my Moto E, the background service
will be restarted on occasion. When that happens, the RemoteIMService is onCreate() again,
and needs to get the cacheword key to reset state on the keymanager, imps, etc, as well, since
Welcome/Lock Activities will not necessarily be called again.

title: make Tor bridge: links clickable always, whether on Tor or not
message:
make Tor bridge: links clickable always, whether on Tor or not

These make it really easy to set up bridges in Orbot.

title: auto-resize images taken with embedded camera for quick transfer
message:
auto-resize images taken with embedded camera for quick transfer

Large files can take a long time to transfer over OTRDATA since many XMPP
servers will throttle the connection if too much data is sent at once.
Since images taken with the embedded camera are more ephemeral in nature,
they do not need to be high quality most of the time.  So this resizing
those images before they are stored in the ChatFileStore and sent using
OTRDATA.

This will also help with devices with limited storage, especially on the
internal storage, since it will keep the IOCipher container file smaller.

replaces https://github.com/guardianproject/ChatSecureAndroid/pull/633

title: make sure all desired accounts sign in on startup
message:
make sure all desired accounts sign in on startup

There was a bug on start up when there are multiple accounts set up.
Something is setting one of the accounts as already signed in, i.e.
Imps.ConnectionStatus.ONLINE before signInAll() is run.  It could also be that
those values were not updated when ChatSecure shutdown, or ChatSecure was
killed before it could update those values.

Really, the offline/connecting/online status info should be fetched live from
XMPP/SMACK rather than using some stored value in the database.  The only such
value that should be stored is ACTIVE_ACCOUNT_KEEP_SIGNED_IN to see whether
the user wants that account to start up automatically. Right now there are
four very similar values stored, but not really consistently used:

* Imps.Account.LAST_LOGIN_STATE
* Imps.Provider.ACCOUNT_CONNECTION_STATUS
* Imps.Provider.ACTIVE_ACCOUNT_KEEP_SIGNED_IN
* Imps.AccountStatus.CONNECTION_STATUS

The particular bit of code changed in this commit only seems to be used when
ChatSecure is setup with a password.  With ChatSecure is used without a
password, the startup stuff is handled in RemoteImService.autoLogin().

title: purge old code structure that launches NewChatActivity for each account
message:
purge old code structure that launches NewChatActivity for each account

Based on the method names, it looks like this code structure is left over
from when things behaved quite a bit differently.  For example, launching
NewChatActivity is the sole action of a method called showAccounts(), and
showActiveAccount() iterates through all active accounts and launches a new
Intent to show NewChatActivity.

title: stop delete prompt after taking audio/pictures, just delete automatically
message:
stop delete prompt after taking audio/pictures, just delete automatically

This removes the Dialog that asks the user whether they want to delete the
original audio or picture file that they just took from ChatSecure in
order to send in a message.  There is no need for this Dialog and it is a
rather big annoyance in a "push to talk" session. If the user wants to
save an image or audio file, they'll first want to see or hear it, which
they can do once it is displayed in the message view.  If they want to
keep it, they can long-press it and choose "Export".

title: prefer internal storage for ChatFileStore, unless there isn't enough space
message:
prefer internal storage for ChatFileStore, unless there isn't enough space

There should be at least 512MB free on the internal storage, otherwise
prefer the external storage, if available.

title: rename IocVfs to ChatFileStore following what it does
message:
rename IocVfs to ChatFileStore following what it does

I could never remember what IocVfs was, or vice versa.  I think
ChatFileStore explains it well.

title: create prompt screen if chat media store or SD card is missing
message:
create prompt screen if chat media store or SD card is missing

The media store was sometimes stored on the External Storage, which can be
removed or even replaced with a different SD Card.  This adds a prompt
screen at startup to warn the user about this, and give them two options
for fixing the situation: delete references to the existing media store or
try changing SD cards.

closes #4531 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4531

title: rename chat_screen_menu to new_chat_menu, its only used in NewChatActivity
message:
rename chat_screen_menu to new_chat_menu, its only used in NewChatActivity

Since chat_screen_menu.xml is only used in NewChatActivity, it should have
a name that matches so it is easy to find which menu goes to which Activity.

title: provide single method for "Shutdown & Lock"
message:
provide single method for "Shutdown & Lock"

This creates a single static method for calling "Shutdown & Lock", so that
other Activities can call it without recreating this code.  Specifically,
for the error dialog when the IOCipher media file is missing or the SD Card
is not present.

This probably should instead be implemented as a static method on ImApp,
but this would require changing how CacheWord works, and that's a bigger
project than should be tackled right before a release.

This follows up on the previous commit, which removed a dead version of
this same method.

title: AccountWizardActivity: purge unused code to clarify "Shutdown & Exit" usage
message:
AccountWizardActivity: purge unused code to clarify "Shutdown & Exit" usage

AccountWizardActivity had accumulated more dead code than living, making it
hard to decipher how the whole "Shutdown & Lock" mechanism works.

title: there is only one VFS, so if its already mounted, nothing to do
message:
there is only one VFS, so if its already mounted, nothing to do

No need to try mounting the VFS again if it is already mounted.  Really,
the code should be refactored so that IocVfs.init() is never called more
than once, but that is a larger project.

title: rename IocVfs.dbFile to dbFilePath to distinguish it from the File instances
message: rename IocVfs.dbFile to dbFilePath to distinguish it from the File instances

title: store the location of IOCipher media store so if its missing, prompt user
message:
store the location of IOCipher media store so if its missing, prompt user

Right now, the IOCipher container file that is the encrypted media store is
not stored in a stable path.  If the External Storage is present when
ChatSecure starts, then it is used, otherwise the Internal Storage is used.
But if ChatSecure starts, then the user ejects the External Storage,
ChatSecure will just try the External Storage path, then crash when it is
not there.  Or vice-versa: if ChatSecure is started when the External
Storage is not mounted, then the user mounts the External Storage,
ChatSecure will look for the media store on External Storage, and crash.

The first step to fixing this problem is storing a preference of where the
media store file should be, so ChatSecure can know whether to just create a
new media store because there never was one, or whether to prompt the user
to put the External Storage back in.  To do that, we have to detect all the
possible variations that could have happened, so there is some crazy logic
in IocVfs.init().

title: move all encrypted store password transformations to single method
message:
move all encrypted store password transformations to single method

ChatSecure currently does some custom transformations on the password that
the user supplies to unlock the encrypted storee.  This change just moves
all those transformations to a single method so we can keep track of them,
and to ensure they are always used.

refs #4531 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4531

title: create IocVfs.initWithoutPassword(Context) for when no password is set
message:
create IocVfs.initWithoutPassword(Context) for when no password is set

This provides a central place to define what happens when the user does not
want to provide a password.

title: unmount IOCipher container on "complete shutdown" to zero out stored keys
message:
unmount IOCipher container on "complete shutdown" to zero out stored keys

Calling VirtualFileSystem.unmount() now zeroes out stored keys and passwords
in memory, so it should be called on Shutdown & Lock.

title: support new IOCipher v0.3 API
message:
support new IOCipher v0.3 API

With IOCipher v0.3, you have to explicitly create a new VFS file, whereas
before VirtualFileSystem.mount() would do it automatically.  This made it
hard to debug situations where something went wrong with the file at the
path that was stored, like the perms changed, or the file was deleted by
another process.  This change makes it more like the UNIX mount command.

refs #4531 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4531

title: switch to IOCipher v0.3
message:
switch to IOCipher v0.3

v0.3 includes:

* improved mount error handling
* build and support fixes for 5.0/Lollipop/android-21

refs #4531 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4531

title: explain why the SQLCipher libs are loaded at app start
message:
explain why the SQLCipher libs are loaded at app start

It is better to have one long delay when the app starts, then a shorter
delay after the user enters her password (i.e. when SQLCipher and IOCipher
are actually used for the first time).

title: do not translate SharedPreferences key strings
message:
do not translate SharedPreferences key strings

The strings used as keys in SharedPreferences should never be translated,
they are used as a unique value to look up the preference value in the
stored preferences.  If this value gets translated, then that means it will
represent a new entry in the SharedPreferences.

title: use a ScrollView for Account Wizard screens to accomodate long translations
message:
use a ScrollView for Account Wizard screens to accomodate long translations

Some languages are more verbose, or also have longer spellings.  Long
languages on a small screen mean the buttons get obscured.

This looks like a big change because I also formatted the file with the
Android formatter.  But literally I just changed the most external item
from a LinearLayout to a ScrollView.

closes #4540 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4540

title: make-release-build: generate APK file name based on `git describe`
message:
make-release-build: generate APK file name based on `git describe`

This marks the APK with the actual version, not just the version that is in
AndroidManifest.xml.  If this build is on a signed tag that matches the
versionName in AndroidManifest.xml, then the APK will be a proper release
APK.  Otherwise, it'll get the whole `git describe` string to mark it as an
non-release build.

message:

title: launch all clicked links into a new Task
message:
launch all clicked links into a new Task

By default, Android's Linkify creates Intents that launches the clicked
link into the same Task.  This doesn't really make sense in ChatSecure,
since you often end up clicking around a browser, Courier, Osmand, etc for
a while and you're still in the ChatSecure Task.  Also, ChatSecure does not
really handle the backstack well, and sometimes crashes because the state
does not get setup properly when returning to ChatSecure.  Hopefully using
a new Task will help some until that stuff is revamped.

closes #4472 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4472

title: purge dead code from MessageView

title: ran ./fix-ellipsis and ./fix-xliff-tags
message:
ran ./fix-ellipsis and ./fix-xliff-tags

These scripts are necessary to leave the translated strings.xml in a usable
state, especially for the XLIFF stuff.  No strings.xml file should be
included without running these two scripts.  Transifex does not handle
this stuff properly, so it corrupts the files, therefore we need this hack.

move Orbot market: link to donottranslate.xml

No need to translate the market: link, the app or website that handles
that URI scheme will do the translation (e.g FDroid, play.google.com)

title: don't automatically linkify in chat windows of accounts running on Tor
message:
don't automatically linkify in chat windows of accounts running on Tor

In order to prevent privacy leaks, disable linkification on chats for
accounts that are running through Tor.  For those how are foolhardy
enough to want linkifying on, they can enable a preference.

All of the @Override decorators were put there Eclipse Android mode...

title: add custom URI scheme linkifying to handle geo:, xmpp:, etc.
message:
add custom URI scheme linkifying to handle geo:, xmpp:, etc.

This lets ChatSecure gracefully handle a lot of different kinds of links,
by making them clickable.  For example, geo: links are a standard form
for sending a location.  Clicking on that link will take the user to that
spot in their maps app.

title: Update update-ant-build.sh to work correctly on current build tool
message:
Update update-ant-build.sh to work correctly on current build tool
versions

If you check out the project from scratch and run the
update-ant-build.sh script with current Android build tools, it fails
with the message 'Error: The project either has no target set or the
target is invalid.', as there is no target parameter in the android
update call. The bat file does not make this mistake.

title: load background bitmaps in a custom AsyncTask
message:
load background bitmaps in a custom AsyncTask

In order to support devices that do not have tons of RAM, dynamically size
the background bitmap when loading so only what is needed is stored in RAM.
Also, there is a much stricker limit of memory allocation when operating in
the main UI thread.  More info here:

https://developer.android.com/training/displaying-bitmaps/load-bitmap.html
https://developer.android.com/training/displaying-bitmaps/process-bitmap.html

fixes #4277 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4277

title: when user selects "End chat", also send OTR FINISHED message
message:
when user selects "End chat", also send OTR FINISHED message

The "End chat" is a very distinct action that is not often taken.  It also
deletes the existing history, etc. so the expectation is that it sets
things up to be more secure.  Therefore, it should also send the OTR
FINISHED message.  That signals the other side of the conversation that OTR
is no longer available, so no message encryption will happen until a new
OTR session is negotiated.  That will prevent the user from mistakenly
sending a message that goes through unencrypted.

title: in "New Account", only show Google option if there are Google accounts
message:

message:

OTRDATA.  It also eliminates another mystery blank, white screen in
response to sharing something to ChatSecure.

message:

title: make ChatSecure claim .ofcaes files that are opened in file managers
message:
make ChatSecure claim .ofcaes files that are opened in file managers

The IntentFilters do file associations very poorly.  These crazy hacks are
the only way I've been able to get file associations working when defining
custom types that do not have built-in mime types, according to Android
itself.

title: show error message if sharing data when all accounts are offline
message:
show error message if sharing data when all accounts are offline

Previously, if a SEND/Share Intent was sent to ChatSecure when it was
offline, ChatSecure would just show a blank white screen.  That screen was
ImUrlActivity doing nothing at all.  When all accounts are offline, this
commit makes the blank white screen go away, and gives an error message in
a Toast.

title: use system names for Languages preferences menu
message:
use system names for Languages preferences menu

Instead of maintaining our own list of the names of the languages, use the
Java names by requesting the "display language" of each locale in that
locale.  This makes only one menu item per language, there are no country
variants supported to keep the list short.  The exception is zh_CN and
zh_TW since there is generally no zh language.  We also have to manually
include 'bo' Tibetan since the system often does not support it.

title: check status of pref.commit() otherwise just use pref.apply()
message:
check status of pref.commit() otherwise just use pref.apply()

apply() does it in the background, but does not provide confirmation.
commit() provides confirmation, but is only useful if the return value is
checked.  apply() happens in the background and commit() in the foreground,
so using apply() should keep things more interactive. The SharedPreferences
docs recommend using apply() if the return value of commit() is ignored.

title: use system names for Languages preferences menu
message:
use system names for Languages preferences menu

Instead of maintaining our own list of the names of the languages, use the
Java names by requesting the "display language" of each locale in that
locale.  This makes only one menu item per language, there are no country
variants supported to keep the list short.  The exception is zh_CN and
zh_TW since there is generally no zh language.  We also have to manually
include 'bo' Tibetan since the system often does not support it.

title: check status of pref.commit() otherwise just use pref.apply()
message:
check status of pref.commit() otherwise just use pref.apply()

apply() does it in the background, but does not provide confirmation.
commit() provides confirmation, but is only useful if the return value is
checked.  apply() happens in the background and commit() in the foreground,
so using apply() should keep things more interactive. The SharedPreferences
docs recommend using apply() if the return value of commit() is ignored.

title: The locale folder "id" should be called "in" instead
message:
The locale folder "id" should be called "in" instead

From the java.util.Locale documentation:
"Note that Java uses several deprecated two-letter codes. The Hebrew ("he")
language code is rewritten as "iw", Indonesian ("id") as "in", and Yiddish
("yi") as "ji". This rewriting happens even if you construct your own Locale
object, not just for instances returned by the various lookup methods.

Because of this, if you add your localized resources in for example values-id
they will not be used, since the system will look for values-in instead.

To work around this, place your resources in a values folder using the
deprecated language code instead.

https://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/Locale.html

title: The locale folder "he" should be called "iw" instead
message:
The locale folder "he" should be called "iw" instead

From the java.util.Locale documentation:
"Note that Java uses several deprecated two-letter codes. The Hebrew ("he")
language code is rewritten as "iw", Indonesian ("id") as "in", and Yiddish
("yi") as "ji". This rewriting happens even if you construct your own Locale
object, not just for instances returned by the various lookup methods.

Because of this, if you add your localized resources in for example values-he
they will not be used, since the system will look for values-iw instead.

To work around this, place your resources in a values folder using the
deprecated language code instead.

https://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/Locale.html

"The given layout_param is not defined for the given layout, meaning it has
no effect. This usually happens when you change the parent layout or move
view code around without updating the layout params. This will cause
useless attribute processing at runtime, and is misleading for others
reading the layout so the parameter should be removed."

title: receive clicked im: URLs (syntax defined in RFC3860)
message:
receive clicked im: URLs (syntax defined in RFC3860)

This provides a more generic URL format for clickable chat links.  It is
also a lot simpler than the xmpp: RFC5122 format since it does not have
"actions", only a to-address and a query string with key=value pairs.

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3860

closes #4092 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4092

title: tweak displayed xmpp: URL to work on more apps and follow RFC5122
message:
tweak displayed xmpp: URL to work on more apps and follow RFC5122

The format of the xmpp: URL in the QR Code did not follow the standard, and
therefore only worked in ChatSecure-Android.  Chris Ballinger had previously
thought that xmpp:to@foo.com URLs didn't work in iOS but he has since gotten
them working.  Therefore it makes sense to use a fully proper RFC5122 URL to
advertise in ChatSecure.

refs #4092 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4092

title: handle all incoming xmpp: URIs using XmppUriHandler.parse()
message:
handle all incoming xmpp: URIs using XmppUriHandler.parse()

This currently just allows for adding a contact, but xmpp: URIs can do lots
of things, including join group chats.

title: XmppUriHelper.parse() parses xmpp:, xmpp://, and xmpp:/// URLs
message:
XmppUriHelper.parse() parses xmpp:, xmpp://, and xmpp:/// URLs

Parse xmpp URIs according to the RFC5122 and XEP-0147, but currently all
that ChatSecure understands is how to add a contact.  This parser will
parse the non-standards-compliant xmpp:// URL that ChatSecure used on both
iOS and Android to work around iOS's issue with xmpp: URLs.

refs #4092 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4092

title: send OTR "FINISHED" message to all OTR sessions on logout
message:
send OTR "FINISHED" message to all OTR sessions on logout

If the user logs out of an account, send the OTR message to end the OTR
session, which notifies the client on the other end that it is no longer
possible to guarantee that their messages will be sent encrypted (e.g. if
the message gets queued as plain text and then resent before OTR is
renegotiated).

refs #520 https://github.com/guardianproject/ChatSecureAndroid/issues/520

title: guarantee a unique XMPP Resource
message:
guarantee a unique XMPP Resource

Since XMPP Servers can direct traffic based on the XMPP Resource,
ChatSecure should ensure that each install has a unique XMPP Resource.
Otherwise, if someone has two instances of ChatSecure running on the same
account, the XMPP Server might always direct traffic to one but not the
other.  Since ChatSecure does not expose the XMPP Resource to the user, it
should be a random string that is then stored

refs #563 https://github.com/guardianproject/ChatSecureAndroid/pull/563
refs #520 https://github.com/guardianproject/ChatSecureAndroid/issues/520

title: include pins for self-signed/cacert.org for people who install those certs
message:
include pins for self-signed/cacert.org for people who install those certs

The following pins are for self-signed certificates and the cacert.org
Certificate Authority certificate.  AndroidPinning will always fail on
these unless they have been manually installed into the system's keystore.
AndroidPinning always does a check using the system's default trust manager

title: update pins to use the CA's certificates
message:
update pins to use the CA's certificates

AndroidPinning will always validate using the system's trust manager, so
there is no use in putting cacert or self-signed certs as pins,
AndroidPinning will always fail since the system's trust manager will fail.
Instead include the CAs' high level, long lived keys for the set of commonly
used servers.  Any XMPP server not signed by one of the pinned CAs will
trigger the MemorizingTrustManager's TOFU/POP prompt.

title: on Sign In, put indeterminite, spinning progress meter in ActionBar
message:
on Sign In, put indeterminite, spinning progress meter in ActionBar

There is not a lot of feedback once you hit the "Sign in" button, so this
tries to put a spinning progress meter in the ActionBar once the "Sign in"
button is pressed.  Because a lot of work is happening on the main thread,
this progress meter does not always show up very quickly.  Ideally, all of
the actions triggered by pressing "Sign in" would happen in an AsyncTask,
and AccountActivity would finish once the AsyncTask finishes.

title: script reproducible release build process (careful, it wipes everything!)

Running this script will delete all files not tracked in git, and will
reset all files tracked in git. So it returns the whole repo to a pristine
state before running the build process.  This is done to ensure that builds
are reproducible only with files that are git.

the hostname verification of SSL goes against the "Service Name"
so if the user manually specifies it, we should use that as the argument
to the ConnectionConfiguration

title: re-add support for not showing offline contacts
message:
re-add support for not showing offline contacts
good for large contact lists like on facebook or google

message: added method to delete contact from all lists (but not using it yet)

message: reuse chat cursor ContentObserver

title: add updateContact() logic to update, instead of insert, existing contacts
message:
add updateContact() logic to update, instead of insert, existing contacts
double contacts where being created due to stale list id's
and lookup logic was matching username and list id
in general it seemd new contact entries in the db were created
for every list a contact was on, instead of mapping contacts to one or more lists
through a join of some sort

to the onResume () method. Also, we should make sure the sidebar is

title: multiple stability fixes for NewChatAct
message:
multiple stability fixes for NewChatAct
- onNewIntent not necessary, as onResume called every time now due to startTask
onNewIntent was causing duplicate calls to initAccount causing problems
- always check if cursors have sufficient capacity for new chats, because
in some cases they don't, and we crash!
- in fragment's don't expect the activity to be there and/or be sure to
use the latest attached activity

title: fail fast on failure to initialize OTR
message:
fail fast on failure to initialize OTR

OTR is not optional.  Failure to initialize OTR makes incoming messages drop on the floor.

This could happen if the OTR keystore is corrupt, the password is incorrect or there is a bug
in order of initialization.  I suspect the latter in a failure case I saw with one of my testers.

title: add AES-256-CBC encrypted file importing for OtrAndroidKeyManagerImpl
message:
add AES-256-CBC encrypted file importing for OtrAndroidKeyManagerImpl

This is the first version of OTR key importing. It is meant to be a simple
but not horribly insecure method while we are waiting for OTR file transfer
to be ironed out.

title: add WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE so Gibberbot can delete imported file from sdcard
message:
add WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE so Gibberbot can delete imported file from sdcard

With the AES file import mechanism, once the file is imported, Gibberbot
should delete it to signify that the import has completed successfully. To
do this, it needs the WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission.

title: ensure OtrAndroidKeyManagerImpl is created whenever getInstance() is called
message:
ensure OtrAndroidKeyManagerImpl is created whenever getInstance() is called

Instead of passing in the central keystory File in one place, and a null in
another, pass in the Context in both places, and move the filename into
getInstance() since that's the only place that ever needs it.  Otherwise if
the OtrAndroidKeyManagerImpl instance does not exist yet, and the arg is
null, getInstance() returns _instance which is still null.

title: removed evil OTR error dialog; moved back to toast

title: fixed to auto-boot and reconnect code
message:
fixed to auto-boot and reconnect code

user reported issue with "sign in" showing up often
aka their accounts were not staying signed in

i tracked it in part to the new code for using networkinfo state
to check if the connection should be made

it was also related to autoboot process killing feature for
the users that really wanted nothing running the background

i believe i have solved both problems

title: updated manifest for rc3 bugfix
message: updated manifest for rc3 bugfix

title: updated strings to reflect "active network" state check
message: updated strings to reflect "active network" state check

title: remove "bg data" deprecated check; use net active/conn
message:
remove "bg data" deprecated check; use net active/conn

some users having issue with background data connectivity
which is now a deprecated concept on android, and a feature
hidden within the data usage settings dialog.

instead we now check if network is active and connected, which
is the recommended approach.

in some cases, proxy settings were not being applied
properly, causing the connection to "fail open" and not
connect via Tor

message: removed unnecessary commented out line

message:
updated rendering of account/provider list

now shows whether account is going through Orbot/Tor or not
and a few other small rendering improvements

title: improvements to address SQL injections from Intent data
message: improvements to address SQL injections from Intent data

title: initAccount() on resume to address empty contact list
message:
initAccount() on resume to address empty contact list

it seems like we need to reinit account on resume each
time we open the activity, to refrefh contact list data

title: disabled failed SSL cert notifications
message:
disabled failed SSL cert notifications

this is handled by MemorizingTrustManager

title: put close button clearly on chat menu
message: put close button clearly on chat menu

message: added a little spacing to form layout

title: fixing "auto boot" pref support
message:
fixing "auto boot" pref support

this wasn't properly working before, and also
leaving processes running when autoboot=false.
now it is working perfectly!

title: initial fixes to reduce SQL injection attack risks
message:
initial fixes to reduce SQL injection attack risks

though unlikely, it is possible for an app to use intents
to cause a local, on-device SQL injection attack.

in addition, via a chat message, a remote user could also
cause a sql injection.

we are working on changes to improve parsing and use of
parameterized inputs to all queries

title: simplify auth mechanism configuration
message:
simplify auth mechanism configuration

these settings are shared across multiple provider instances
and each time one or the other logs in or reconnects, it has
to reset these values. the new setup simplifies the settings
so they work across all types (google oauth, XMPP plain, etc)

title: fixes Google OAuth2 support to re-up key on login
message:
fixes Google OAuth2 support to re-up key on login

previously only requested/stored oauth2 key on account setup, which was wrong.
now the XMPPConnection requests a new key each time upon login, transparently to the user.
the only password stored is the x-google-token string in the account password field
which indicates that the GTalkOauth2 SASL auth should be used.
all GTalkOAuth2 code has been centralized in GTalkOAuth2.java class.

title: Extract toast message strings to strings.xml
message:
Extract toast message strings to strings.xml

Since the messages are displayed to the user when enabling/disabling OTR
for a chat, we should make it possible to localize them.

title: Show toast when start-/stopping encrypted chat
message:
Show toast when start-/stopping encrypted chat

Instead of displaying a progress dialog simply show a toast message and
perform the requested action in the background. The warning view and the
options menu entry are updated once the action has been processed.

This fixes issue #42.

title: Properly set sound notification (fixes #117)
message:
Properly set sound notification (fixes #117)

Set the ringtone URI to the default ringtone if sound notification is
enabled. Set it to null otherwise.

This fixes the problem that sound notifications are not sent anymore
once the user has disabled and then re-enabled them. The reason was,
that the ringtone URI would never be set to a valid value once it had
been set to null.

once the user has disabled and then re-enabled them. The reason was,
that the ringtone URI would never be set to a valid value once it had
been set to null.
